title: 110_hr5891
content:
There are no paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk, so I will summarize the curr_chunk as follows:

"SECTION 1. FINDINGS." The Big Thicket National Preserve in East Texas, established in 1974, is known for its diverse species and habitats. Congress expanded its boundary in 1993 to increase biological diversity. In 2007, the National Park Service acquired timberland in the region for the Preserve. The Big Thicket National Preserve in East Texas was expanded in 1993 to increase biological diversity. The National Park Service recently acquired timberland, reaching the authorized boundary of 97,000 acres. The Big Thicket National Preserve in East Texas was expanded in 1993 to increase biological diversity, reaching the authorized boundary of 97,000 acres. SEC. 2. BOUNDARY ADJUSTMENT. The Act authorizes the expansion of the Big Thicket National Preserve in Texas by adding up to 100,000 acres of land from willing sellers. The map depicting the proposed boundary expansion is available for inspection at National Park Service offices. The Act allows for the expansion of the Big Thicket National Preserve in Texas by adding up to 100,000 acres of land from willing sellers. The Secretary may accept title to lands outside the preserve if they contribute significantly to its purposes. The Act allows for the expansion of the Big Thicket National Preserve in Texas by adding up to 100,000 acres of land from willing sellers. Private landowners can request immediate removal of their property from the preserve boundaries by submitting a written request to the Secretary. The Secretary of the Interior will create canopy walks, elevated boardwalks, and interpretation to connect visitors with the ecological diversity of Big Thicket National Preserve. Special consideration may be given to areas that are hard to access. Additionally, there will be a Big Thicket National Preserve Interpretive Center. The Secretary of the Interior will construct an interpretive center in Big Thicket National Preserve for educational purposes and create canoe and kayaking trails with GPS guidance and docking platforms. Authorization of appropriations is also included. Authorization of appropriations is granted to the Secretary of the Interior for the implementation of this Act and its amendments.
